title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Five years after Australia’s original green bank was saved by Clive Palmer after a meeting with Al Gore, the Morrison government announced it would dedicate $1 billion to clean energy projects. The policy decision was prompted by concerns about a lack of reliability in the energy grid. The "reliability" fund is designed to operate as a bank to support private investors. “Government will play as much of a role as we have to, but as little as possible,” Energy and Emissions Reduction Minister Angus Taylor said at a press conference. Image: News Corp Australia
